content:
TITLE: Instantiating HubSpot Client with Access Token in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Creates a new HubSpot client instance using an access token for authentication. This is the standard way to initialize the client for API access.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const hubspot = require('@hubspot/api-client')
const hubspotClient = new hubspot.Client({ accessToken: YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing HubSpot API Client in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the HubSpot API client package using npm, which is required to use the HubSpot API with Node.js.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm install @hubspot/api-client
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic API Usage Pattern for HubSpot Client
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the standard promise-based pattern for making API calls with the HubSpot client, including error handling with promises.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
hubspotClient.crm.contacts.basicApi
    .getPage(limit, after, properties, propertiesWithHistory, associations, archived)
    .then((results) => {
        console.log(results)
    })
    .catch((err) => {
        console.error(err)
    })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Searching for Contacts in HubSpot CRM (JavaScript Example)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates search functionality for contacts in HubSpot using the search API with filter groups, sorting, and property selection in JavaScript.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const publicObjectSearchRequest = {
    filterGroups: [
    {
        filters: [
        {
            propertyName: 'createdate',
            operator: 'GTE',
            value: `${Date.now() - 30 * 60000}`
        }
        ]
    }
    ],
    sorts: [{ propertyName: 'createdate', direction: 'DESCENDING' }],
    properties: ['createdate', 'firstname', 'lastname'],
    limit: 100,
    after: 0,
}

const response = await hubspotClient.crm.contacts.searchApi.doSearch(publicObjectSearchRequest)

console.log(response)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating and Associating Contact and Company in HubSpot CRM
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a new contact and company in HubSpot and then create an association between them using the v4 associations API.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const contactObj = {
    properties: {
        firstname: yourValue,
        lastname: yourValue,
    },
}
const companyObj = {
    properties: {
        domain: yourValue,
        name: yourValue,
    },
}

const createContactResponse = await hubspotClient.crm.contacts.basicApi.create(contactObj)
const createCompanyResponse = await hubspotClient.crm.companies.basicApi.create(companyObj)
await hubspotClient.crm.associations.v4.basicApi.create(
    'companies',
    createCompanyResponse.id,
    'contacts',
    createContactResponse.id,
    [
        {
              "associationCategory": "HUBSPOT_DEFINED",
              "associationTypeId": AssociationTypes.companyToContact
              // AssociationTypes contains the most popular HubSpot defined association types
        }
    ]
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Uploading a File to HubSpot Files API
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to upload a file to HubSpot's file storage using the files API, including stream creation, path specification, and upload options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const response = await hubspotClient.files.filesApi.upload(
    {
        data: fs.createReadStream('./photo.jpg'),
        name: 'photo.jpg'
    },
    undefined,
    '/folder',
    'photo.jpg',
    undefined,
    JSON.stringify({
        access: 'PRIVATE',
        overwrite: false,
        duplicateValidationStrategy: 'NONE',
        duplicateValidationScope: 'ENTIRE_PORTAL',
    })
)

console.log(response)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Searching for Contacts in HubSpot CRM (TypeScript Example)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates search functionality for contacts in HubSpot using strongly-typed interfaces for the search request in TypeScript with simplified sort syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
const objectSearchRequest: PublicObjectSearchRequest = {
    filterGroups: [
        {
            filters: [
                {
                propertyName: "createdate",
                operator: "GTE",
                value: "1615709177000",
                },
            ],
        },
    ],
    sorts: ["-createdate"],
    properties: ["email", "createdate"],
    limit: 100,
    after: '0',
};

const response = await hubspotClient.crm.contacts.searchApi.doSearch(objectSearchRequest);

console.log(response)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving All Records from HubSpot CRM Objects
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the getAll convenience method which retrieves all records for a specific CRM object type, handling pagination automatically.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const allContacts = await hubspotClient.crm.contacts.getAll()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing Contacts from CSV File to HubSpot CRM
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to import contacts from a CSV file using the imports API, including column mapping configuration and file handling with streams.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const fs = require('fs')

const fileName = 'test.csv'

const file = {
    data: fs.createReadStream(fileName),
    name: fileName,
};

const importRequest = {
    name: 'import(' + fileName + ')',
    files: [
        {
            fileName: fileName,
            fileImportPage: {
                hasHeader: true,
                columnMappings: [
                    {
                        columnName: 'First Name',
                        propertyName: 'firstname',
                        columnObjectType: 'CONTACT',
                    },
                    {
                        columnName: 'Email',
                        propertyName: 'email',
                        columnObjectType: 'CONTACT',
                    },
                ],
            },
        },
    ],
}

const response = await  hubspotClient.crm.imports.coreApi.create(file, JSON.stringify(importRequest));

console.log(response)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Batch Updating Multiple Deal Objects in HubSpot CRM
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to update multiple deal objects simultaneously using the batch API, which is more efficient than making individual API calls.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const dealObj = {
    id: yourId,
    properties: {
        amount: yourValue,
    },
}

const dealObj2 = {
    id: yourId,
    properties: {
        amount: yourValue,
    },
}

await hubspotClient.crm.deals.batchApi.update({ inputs: [dealObj, dealObj2] })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Obtaining and Refreshing OAuth Tokens for HubSpot API
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to refresh an OAuth access token using client credentials and a refresh token, then updating the client to use the new token.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
hubspotClient.oauth.tokensApi
    .create('refresh_token', undefined, undefined, YOUR_CLIENT_ID, YOUR_CLIENT_SECRET, YOUR_REFRESH_TOKEN)
    .then((results) => {
        console.log(results)

        // this assigns the accessToken to the client, so your client is ready
        // to use
        hubspotClient.setAccessToken(results.accessToken)

        return hubspotClient.crm.companies.basicApi.getPage()
    })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Instantiating HubSpot Client with Developer API Key
DESCRIPTION: Creates a HubSpot client instance using a developer API key for authentication instead of an access token.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const hubspotClient = new hubspot.Client({ developerApiKey: YOUR_DEVELOPER_API_KEY })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Instantiating HubSpot Client with Both Access Token and Developer API Key
DESCRIPTION: Creates a HubSpot client instance with both an access token and a developer API key, allowing access to all endpoints supported by either authentication method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const hubspotClient = new hubspot.Client({ accessToken: YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN, developerApiKey: YOUR_DEVELOPER_API_KEY })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing HubSpot Client in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to import and initialize the HubSpot client in a TypeScript project. Requires either an access token or a developer API key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_28

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import * as hubspot from '@hubspot/api-client'
const hubspotClient = new hubspot.Client({ accessToken: YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN , developerApiKey: YOUR_DEVELOPER_API_KEY })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Instantiating HubSpot Client with ES Modules
DESCRIPTION: Creates a HubSpot client instance using ES modules import syntax instead of CommonJS require. Useful for projects using modern JavaScript module systems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { Client } from "@hubspot/api-client";
const hubspotClient = new Client({ accessToken: YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Getting Companies Associated with a Contact in HubSpot CRM
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves a paginated list of companies associated with a specific contact using the v4 associations API with pagination parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const companies = await hubspotClient.crm.associations.v4.basicApi.getPage(
    'contact',
    hubspotContactId,
    'company',
    after,
    pageSize,
  );
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Making Direct API Requests to Unwrapped HubSpot Endpoints
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the apiRequest method to access HubSpot endpoints that are not yet wrapped by the client library. This method inherits all the client's configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
hubspotClient.apiRequest({
    method: 'PUT',
    path: '/some/api/not/wrapped/yet',
    body: { key: 'value' },
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Automatic Retry for Failed HubSpot API Requests
DESCRIPTION: Sets up automatic retry logic for the HubSpot client to handle rate limit (429) and server error (5xx) responses, with configurable retry attempts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const hubspotClient = new hubspot.Client({
    accessToken: YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN,
    numberOfApiCallRetries: 3,
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Rate Limiting for HubSpot API Client
DESCRIPTION: Sets up rate limiting for the HubSpot client using Bottleneck to prevent API quota violations, with custom options to control request frequency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const hubspotClient = new hubspot.Client({
    accessToken: YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN,
    limiterOptions: DEFAULT_LIMITER_OPTIONS,
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Uploading a File to HubSpot File Manager
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to upload a file to the HubSpot File Manager using FormData and the apiRequest method. Requires specifying the folder path and reading the file from the filesystem.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const formData = new FormData();
const options = {
// some options
};
formData.append("folderPath", '/');
formData.append("options", JSON.stringify(options));
formData.append("file", fs.createReadStream('file path'));

const response = await hubspotClient.apiRequest({
    method: 'POST',
    path: '/filemanager/api/v3/files/upload',
    body: formData,
    defaultJson: false
});

console.log(response);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Handling Reserved Words in HubSpot API Requests
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to handle JavaScript reserved words (like 'from' and 'in') when making API requests by prefixing them with an underscore. This example creates an association between a contact and a company.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const BatchInputPublicAssociation = {
    inputs: [
        {
            _from: {
                id : 'contactID'
            },
            to: {
                id: 'companyID'
            },
            type: 'contact_to_company'
        }
    ]
};

const response = await hubspotClient.crm.associations.batchApi.create(
    'contacts',
    'companies',
    BatchInputPublicAssociation
);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating OAuth Authorization URL for HubSpot API
DESCRIPTION: Creates an authorization URL for initiating the OAuth flow with HubSpot, which is used to redirect users for permission granting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const clientId = 'your_client_id'
const redirectUri = 'take_me_to_the_ballpark'
const scope = 'some scopes'
const uri = hubspotClient.oauth.getAuthorizationUrl(clientId, redirectUri, scope)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Obtaining Access Token from Authorization Code in HubSpot OAuth Flow
DESCRIPTION: Uses the OAuth tokensApi to create an access token from an authorization code received during the OAuth flow. Requires client ID, client secret, and redirect URI.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
return hubspotClient.oauth.tokensApi.create(
        'authorization_code',
        code, // the code you received from the oauth flow
        YOUR_REDIRECT_URI,
        YOUR_CLIENT_ID,
        YOUR_CLIENT_SECRET,
    ).then(...)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Search-Specific Rate Limiter Settings for HubSpot Client
DESCRIPTION: Defines rate limiting settings specifically for search operations, which are more restrictive than the default settings to prevent search quota issues.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const SEARCH_LIMITER_OPTIONS = {
    minTime: 550,
    maxConcurrent: 3,
    id: 'search-hubspot-client-limiter',
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Custom Headers to HubSpot Client Requests
DESCRIPTION: Creates a HubSpot client with custom headers that will be sent with every API request, useful for tracking or special authentication needs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const hubspotClient = new hubspot.Client({
    accessToken: YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN,
    defaultHeaders: { 'My-header': 'test-example' },
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring HubSpot Client with Custom Base Path
DESCRIPTION: Creates a HubSpot client with a custom base path URL, which allows pointing the client to different HubSpot environments or proxies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const hubspotClient = new hubspot.Client({ accessToken: YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN, basePath: 'https://some-url' })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fetching Contacts Using Direct API Request
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to get contact data by making a direct API request to the CRM contacts endpoint, then processing the JSON response.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const response = await hubspotClient.apiRequest({
    path: '/crm/v3/objects/contacts',
})
const json = await response.json()
console.log(json)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving CMS Audit Logs from HubSpot
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to fetch audit logs from the HubSpot CMS using the auditLogsApi. Returns a paginated response of audit logs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const response = await hubspotClient.cms.auditLogs.auditLogsApi.getPage()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Default Rate Limiter Settings for HubSpot Client
DESCRIPTION: Shows the default rate limiting configuration used by the HubSpot client, which allows 9 requests per second with up to 6 concurrent requests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const DEFAULT_LIMITER_OPTIONS = {
    minTime: 1000 / 9,
    maxConcurrent: 6,
    id: 'hubspot-client-limiter',
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Method Name Changes in HubSpot API Node.js Client
DESCRIPTION: This snippet lists the breaking changes in method names for various API endpoints in the HubSpot API Node.js client. It covers changes across multiple modules including associations, companies, contacts, deals, timeline, and webhooks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
### Breaking changes:

- Updated clients method names:
  1. archiveBatch => archive (crm.associations.batchApi)
  2. createBatch => create (crm.associations.batchApi)
  3. readBatch => read (crm.associations.batchApi)
  4. getTypes => getAll (crm.associations.typesApi)
  5. archiveAssociation => archive (crm.companies.associationsApi, crm.contacts.associationsApi, crm.deals.associationsApi, crm.lineItems.associationsApi, crm.products.associationsApi, crm.quotes.associationsApi, crm.tickets.associationsApi)
  6. createAssociation => create (crm.companies.associationsApi, crm.contacts.associationsApi, crm.deals.associationsApi, crm.lineItems.associationsApi, crm.products.associationsApi, crm.quotes.associationsApi, crm.tickets.associationsApi)
  7. getAssociations => getAll (crm.companies.associationsApi, crm.contacts.associationsApi, crm.deals.associationsApi, crm.lineItems.associationsApi, crm.products.associationsApi, crm.quotes.associationsApi, crm.tickets.associationsApi)
  8. archiveBatch => archive (crm.companies.batchApi, crm.contacts.batchApi, crm.deals.batchApi, crm.lineItems.batchApi, crm.products.batchApi, crm.quotes.batchApi, crm.tickets.batchApi)
  9. createBatch => create (crm.companies.batchApi, crm.contacts.batchApi, crm.deals.batchApi, crm.lineItems.batchApi, crm.products.batchApi, crm.quotes.batchApi, crm.tickets.batchApi)
  10. readBatch => read (crm.companies.batchApi, crm.contacts.batchApi, crm.deals.batchApi, crm.lineItems.batchApi, crm.products.batchApi, crm.quotes.batchApi, crm.tickets.batchApi)
  11. updateBatch => update (crm.companies.batchApi, crm.contacts.batchApi, crm.deals.batchApi, crm.lineItems.batchApi, crm.products.batchApi, crm.quotes.batchApi, crm.tickets.batchApi)
  12. archiveEventTemplate => archive (crm.timeline.templatesApi)
  13. createEventTemplate => create (crm.timeline.templatesApi)
  14. getAllEventTemplates => getAll (crm.timeline.templatesApi)
  15. getEventTemplateById => getById (crm.timeline.templatesApi)
  16. updateEventTemplate => update (crm.timeline.templatesApi)
  17. archiveEventTemplateToken => archive (crm.timeline.tokensApi)
  18. createEventTemplateToken => create (crm.timeline.tokensApi)
  19. updateEventTemplateToken => update (crm.timeline.tokensApi)
  20. clearSettings => clear (webhooks.settingsApi)
  21. configureSettings => configure (webhooks.settingsApi)
  22. getSettings => getAll (webhooks.settingsApi)
  23. deleteSubscription => archive ()
  24. getSubscription => getById (webhooks.subscriptionsApi)
  25. getSubscriptions => getAll (webhooks.subscriptionsApi)
  26. updateSubscription => update (webhooks.subscriptionsApi)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Reserved Word Parameter
DESCRIPTION: Example showing the use of _from instead of from since it's a reserved word in JavaScript
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Don't use 'from' (reserved word)
// from: 'value'

// Use '_from' instead
_from: 'value'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enum Type Conversion Example in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Shows the conversion pattern from TypeScript type-based enums to traditional TypeScript enums. Demonstrates the change in enum implementation style for better type safety.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
export type Enum = "OPTION1" | "OPTION2";
// =>
export enum Enum {
    Option1 = 'OPTION1',
    Option2 = 'OPTION2'
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Updated Method Name for CRM GDPR
DESCRIPTION: Example showing the method name change from postCrmV3ObjectsContactsGdprDelete to purge for GDPR-related operations
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Old way
crm.contants.gdpr.postCrmV3ObjectsContactsGdprDelete()

// New way
crm.contants.gdpr.purge()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Release Tags for HubSpot API Node.js Client Versions
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides links to release tags for various versions of the HubSpot API Node.js client on GitHub. It covers versions from 1.0.0-beta to 12.0.1, including beta releases and major version updates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
[Unreleased]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/compare/12.0.1...HEAD
[1.0.0-beta]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/v1.0.0-beta
[1.1.0-beta]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/v1.1.0-beta
[2.0.1]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/2.0.1
[2.1.0]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/2.1.0
[2.1.1]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/2.1.1
[3.1.0]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/3.1.0
[3.2.0]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/3.2.0
[3.2.1]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/3.2.1
[3.2.6]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/3.2.6
[3.3.0]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/3.3.0
[3.4.0]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/3.4.0
[3.4.1]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/3.4.1
[4.0.0]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/4.0.0
[4.1.0]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/4.1.0
[5.0.0]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/5.0.0
[6.0.0-beta]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/6.0.0-beta
[6.0.1-beta]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/6.0.1-beta
[6.0.1-beta1]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/6.0.1-beta1
[6.0.1-beta2]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/6.0.1-beta2
[6.0.1-beta3]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/6.0.1-beta3
[6.0.1-beta4]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/6.0.1-beta4
[6.0.1-beta5]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/6.0.1-beta5
[6.0.1-beta.6]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/6.0.1-beta.6
[6.0.1]: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/releases/tag/6.0.1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: CRM Lists Type Changes
DESCRIPTION: Type modifications for list IDs and related parameters in CRM Lists API, changing number types to strings and adding new parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
interface ListChanges {
  listIds: Array<string>;  // Changed from Array<number>
  listId: string;          // Changed from number
  requestBody: Array<string>; // Changed from Array<number>
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: CRM Object Creation Type Updates
DESCRIPTION: Updates to input types for CRM object creation methods, changing from SimplePublicObjectInput to SimplePublicObjectInputForCreate.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
crm.companies.basicApi.create(SimplePublicObjectInputForCreate)
crm.companies.batchApi.create(BatchInputSimplePublicObjectInputForCreate)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updated CRM Object Path
DESCRIPTION: Example showing the path change for feedback submissions in the CRM objects API
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Old path
crm.objects.feedbackSubmissions

// New path
crm.feedbackSubmissions
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Marketing Events API Renames
DESCRIPTION: Method renames and moves in the Marketing Events API for better clarity and organization.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// Old
marketing.events.attendanceSubscriberStateChangesApi.create()
marketing.events.batchApi.archiveBatch()

// New
marketing.events.attendanceSubscriberStateChangesApi.createByContactIds()
marketing.events.basicApi.batchArchive()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updated API Method Signature - CMS Audit Logs
DESCRIPTION: Modified parameter order in the CMS audit logs getPage method to improve consistency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: TypeScript
CODE:
```
cms.auditLogs.auditLogsApi.getPage(userId?: Array<string>, eventType?: Array<string>, objectType?: Array<string>, objectId?: Array<string>, after?: string, before?: string, limit?: number, sort?: Array<string>, _options?: Configuration)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updated API Method Signature - CRM Extensions Cards
DESCRIPTION: Changed return type and parameter order for CRM extension cards API methods.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: TypeScript
CODE:
```
crm.extensions.cards.cardsApi.archive(cardId: string, appId: number, _options?: Configuration)

crm.extensions.cards.cardsApi.getById(cardId: string, appId: number, _options?: Configuration): Promise<PublicCardResponse>

crm.extensions.cards.cardsApi.update(cardId: string, appId: number, cardPatchRequest: CardPatchRequest, _options?: Configuration): Promise<PublicCardResponse>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: HubDB Tables API Parameter Updates
DESCRIPTION: Updates to the parameter order in HubDB tables API methods to standardize the position of optional parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
cms.hubdb.tablesApi.getDraftTableDetailsById(tableIdOrName: string, includeForeignIds?: boolean, archived?: boolean, _options?: Configuration)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Event Parameters Reordering
DESCRIPTION: Changes to parameter order in events.eventsApi.getPage() method for better organization of optional parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
events.eventsApi.getPage({
  objectType?: string,
  eventType?: string,
  after?: string,
  before?: string,
  limit?: number,
  sort?: Array<string>,
  occurredAfter?: Date,
  occurredBefore?: Date,
  objectId?: number,
  objectPropertyPropname?: any,
  propertyPropname?: any,
  id?: Array<string>
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: OAuth API Method Renames
DESCRIPTION: Simplified naming of OAuth-related API methods by removing redundant terms from method names.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
oauth.accessTokensApi.get
oauth.refreshTokensApi.archive
oauth.refreshTokensApi.get
oauth.tokensApi.create
```

TITLE: Documenting Version Release in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to document a version release with a date in Markdown format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
## [12.0.1] - 2024-09-23
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Documenting Unreleased Changes in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to link to unreleased changes in a GitHub repository using Markdown syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
## [Unreleased](https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/compare/12.0.1...HEAD)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Changes in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to list changes under a specific category (Fixes) in Markdown format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/HubSpot/hubspot-api-nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
## Fixes

- Fixed build errors.
```
